TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {8323=Considering a time window of 24h starting at 10:00 UTC on Sat 13 June, there are many potentially useful passes.}
textBeforeTable: Currently, following NOAA satellites are active on 137 MHz APT and 1.7 GHz HRPT: Frequencies 9 Lessons Learned 8 2009-09-16 7 2009-07-10 6 2009-07-04 5 2009-06-13 4 2009-06-12 3 2009-06-11 2 Passes 1 Frequencies Contents This experiment is trivial, nonetheless it validates the RF-part of the setup. It will also reveal whether additional hardware like LNA is required. WXAPT example from GNU Radio USRP with TVRX Turnstile antenna (or arrow) ← GRAPT Overview Revision as of 08:44, 23 September 2009 == Passes ==   == Passes ==       '''TODO:''' METEOR, [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MetOp MetOp] and [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NPOESS NPOESS]? +       ''Source: [http://noaasis.noaa.gov/NOAASIS/ml/status.html NOAASIS Satellite Status Information]''   ''Source: [http://noaasis.noaa.gov/NOAASIS/ml/status.html NOAASIS Satellite Status Information]''
textAfterTable: Source: NOAASIS Satellite Status Information TODO: METEOR, MetOp and NPOESS? Passes Considering a time window of 24h starting at 10:00 UTC on Sat 13 June, there are many potentially useful passes. NOAA passes occuring between 2009/06/13 10:00 – 2009/06/14 10:00 UTC We only need a few good passes for successful experiment and they should be distributed over time in order to allow debugging and problem fixing between the passes. 2009-06-11 Created this page preparing for the experiment to be carried out during the weekend 13-14 Jun 2009. Need to upgrade laptops and install recent GNU Radio 2009-06-12 Upgraded laptops to Ubuntu 9.04 and GNU Radio 3.2 Problems with example APT receiver since it uses 32k audio but my crap HW can only do 44k1 or 48k. 2009-06-13 I realized that I brought a BNC male/male adapter instead of a female/female that I need to connect my antenna to the TVRX. Experiment postponed! 2009-07-04 Tested GNU Radio with new OSS drivers from
